headline: Realty Income Announces 668th Consecutive Common Stock Monthly Dividend
summary: Realty Income Corporation (Realty Income, NYSE: O), The Monthly Dividend Company®, today announced that it has declared its 668th consecutive common stock monthly dividend. The dividend amount of $0.2700 per share, representing an annualized amount of $3.240 per share, is payable on March 13, 2026 to stockholders of record as of February 27, 2026.

headline: Should Extra Space Storage Stock Be in Your Portfolio Pre-Q4 Earnings?
summary: EXR is set to report Q4 2025 results on Feb. 19, with revenues anticipated to rise year over year, while FFO per share is expected to remain flat.

headline: Realty Income Shifts Beyond Retail With Logistics And Gaming Expansion
summary: Realty Income (NYSE:O) is expanding through new investments in logistics properties via a recent joint venture. The company has also entered preferred equity investments in gaming properties, signaling a broader real estate focus. These moves reflect a shift in its growth approach beyond traditional retail and commercial real estate. Realty Income, known for its monthly dividend model and focus on net lease real estate, is now putting more attention on logistics and gaming assets. For you...

headline: How Investors May Respond To Realty Income (O) Partnering With GIC To Target U.S. Logistics Assets
summary: In recent months, Realty Income, “The Monthly Dividend Company,” expanded its portfolio through large-scale logistics and gaming investments, while forming a more than US$1.70 billion real estate partnership with Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund GIC to pursue U.S. logistics assets and other income-producing properties. These moves, combined with over 55 years of monthly dividends and three decades of annual payout increases, underline how Realty Income is using new capital partnerships to...

headline: Realty Income's Pre-Earnings Rally Is Too Fast For My Liking (Rating Downgrade)
summary: Realty Income trades at a forward AFFO multiple of 15.1x, still below its 10-year average. Click here to find out why O stock is a Hold.

headline: Assessing Realty Income (NYSE:O) Valuation After Recent Share Price Momentum Reignites Investor Interest
summary: Realty Income (O) is back on investors’ radar after recent share price moves, with the stock closing at $65.66. That has many income focused investors rechecking the REIT’s fundamentals. See our latest analysis for Realty Income. The recent move to $65.66 comes on top of a 6.9% 1 month share price return and a 14.6% year to date share price return. The 1 year total shareholder return of 25.7% points to momentum that has been building rather than fading. If this has you rethinking where income...
